<line: 21> THE DEFENDANT:

[TEXT]
<line: 23> ☒    pleaded guilty to count(s) Information
<line: 24> ☐    pleaded nolo contendere to count(s)  which was accepted by the court.
<line: 25> ☐    after a plea of not guilty was found guilty on count(s) 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> The defendant is adjudicated guilty of these offenses:

[TITLE]
<line: 29> Title and Section
<line: 30> Nature of Offense

[TEXT]
<line: 32> Offense Ended
<line: 33> Count Number(s)

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1326(a) and 
<line: 36> (b)
<line: 37> Reentry of a Removed Alien

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 03/09/2016

[TEXT]
<line: 41> The defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through 3 of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant to the Sentencing 
<line: 42> Reform Act of 1984.

[TEXT]
<line: 44> ☐  The defendant has been found not guilty on count .
<line: 45> ☐  Count   dismissed on the motion of the United States.

[TEXT]
<line: 47> IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of 
<line: 48> name, residence, or mailing address until all fines, restitution, costs, and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. 
<line: 49> If ordered to pay restitution, the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic 
<line: 50> circumstances.

[TITLE]
<line: 52> 03/23/2016

[TEXT]
<line: 54> Date of Imposition of Judgment

[TITLE]
<line: 56> /s/ Scott W. Skavdahl

[TITLE]

<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev 12/10) Sheet 2 - Imprisonment

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment - Page 2 of 3

[TITLE]
<line: 8> Defendant: JUAN MERCED-CID,
<line: 9> Case Number: 2:16CR00982-001KG

[TITLE]
<line: 11> IMPRISONMENT

[TEXT]
<line: 13> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of  15  days 
<line: 14> or time served, whichever is less.

[TEXT]
<line: 16> The Court recommends that Immigration and Customs Enforcement begin immediate removal proceedings.
<line: 17> Pursuant to section 5D1.1(c), the Court will not impose a term of supervised release. 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> ☐ The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons:

[TEXT]
<line: 21> ☒    The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal.
<line: 22> ☐    The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district:
<line: 23>         ☐    at  on 
<line: 24>         ☐    as notified by the United States Marshal.
<line: 25> ☐    The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons:
<line: 26>         ☐    before 2 p.m. on 
<line: 27>         ☐    as notified by the United States Marshal.
<line: 28>         ☐    as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office.

[TITLE]
<line: 30> RETURN

[TEXT]
<line: 32> I have executed this judgment as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 34> Defendant delivered on 
<line: 35> to
<line: 36> at
<line: 37> with a Certified copy of this Judgment.

[ABANDON]
<line: 39> UNITED STATES MARSHAL
<line: 40> By 
<line: 41> DEPUTY UNITED STATES MARSHAL

<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev 12/10) Sheet 5, Part A – Criminal Monetary Penalties

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment - Page 3 of 3

[TITLE]
<line: 8> Defendant: JUAN MERCED-CID,
<line: 9> Case Number: 2:16CR00982-001KG

[TITLE]
<line: 11> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 13> The defendant must pay the following total criminal monetary penalties in accordance with the schedule of payments.
<line: 14> ☒     The Court hereby remits the defendant's Special Penalty Assessment; the fee is waived and no payment is required.

[TEXT]
<line: 16> Assessment
<line: 17> Fine
<line: 18> Restitution
<line: 19> $100.00 (WAIVED)
<line: 20> $
<line: 21> $

[TITLE]
<line: 23> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 25> Payments shall be applied in the following order (1) assessment; (2) restitution; (3) fine principal; (4) cost of prosecution; (5) interest; 
<line: 26> (6) penalties.

[TEXT]
<line: 28> The defendant will receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed.

[TEXT]
<line: 30> A     ☐     In full immediately; or
<line: 31> B     ☐     $ immediately, balance due (see special instructions regarding payment of criminal monetary penalties).

[TEXT]
<line: 33> Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties: Criminal monetary penalties are to be made 
<line: 34> payable by cashier's check, bank or postal money order to the U.S. District Court Clerk, 333 Lomas Blvd. NW, Albuquerque, 
<line: 35> New Mexico 87102 unless otherwise noted by the court. Payments must include defendant's name, current address, case 
<line: 36> number and type of payment.

[TEXT]
<line: 38> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise in the special instructions above, if this judgment imposes a period of imprisonment, 
<line: 39> payment of criminal monetary penalties shall be due during the period of imprisonment. All criminal monetary penalty payments, 
<line: 40> except those payments made through the Bureau of Prisons' Inmate Financial Responsibility Program, are to be made as directed by 
<line: 41> the court, the probation officer, or the United States attorney.
